titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that an artistic tribute to commemorate the speech given by President Ronald Reagan at the Brandenburg Gate on June 12, 1987, should be placed within the United States Capitol.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

bill.summary: 6/12/2006--Introduced. Declares the sense of Congress that an artistic tribute to commemorate the speech given by President Ronald Reagan at the Brandenburg Gate on June 12, 1987, during which he uttered the immortal lines, "Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall," should be placed within the U.S. Capitol.
